summary: This document contains various records related to the assignment of a right-of-way and easement involving Jeffrey Epstein as trustee of the Zorro Trust and as president of Cypress, Inc. It details the terms of the assignment, including responsibilities and liabilities associated with the right-of-way granted by the New Mexico State Land Office. This document contains various correspondence and applications related to agricultural leases and subleases involving Zorro Ranch and the New Mexico State Land Office. It includes details about right-of-way easements, applications for subleasing, and communications between the ranch management and state officials. This document contains various correspondence and records related to agricultural leases and subleases involving Jeffrey Epstein and the Zorro Trust. It includes applications for subleases, approvals, and recommendations from the New Mexico State Land Office regarding the management and use of state trust lands. This document outlines the terms and conditions of a grazing lease agreement involving Jeffrey E. Epstein as the trustee for the Zorro Trust. It includes details about the leased land, compliance with laws, and responsibilities of the lessee. The document also references various acknowledgments and requirements for execution. This document contains correspondence related to the Zorro Ranch and its agricultural lease, GM2791, in New Mexico. It includes communications regarding the cancellation of a grass landing strip permit, compliance requirements for the lease, and the renewal process for the lease set to expire in 1999. Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as the contact for the Zorro Trust, which holds the lease. This document contains affidavits and powers of attorney executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein in relation to the Zorro Trust. It details the appointment of John J. Kelly as attorney-in-fact for transactions involving real property in Santa Fe County, New Mexico, and includes a limited power of attorney for Brice Gordon. The document highlights Epstein's role as trustee and outlines the legal authority granted to his agents.

events.title: Right-of-Way Assignment
events.description: An assignment of right-of-way and easement was executed between Zorro Trust and Cypress, Inc.

events.title: Grant of Right-of-Way
events.description: The State of New Mexico granted a right-of-way easement to Zorro Trust for a water pipeline.

events.title: Right-of-Way Easement Application
events.description: Application for a right-of-way easement was submitted by Zorro Trust for state land.

events.title: Right-of-Way Application Processing
events.description: The New Mexico State Land Office received an application for a new right-of-way from Zorro Trust.

events.title: Grant of Right-of-Way
events.description: The completed grant of right-of-way was sent to Zorro Trust for approval.

events.title: Right-of-Way Application Approval
events.description: Approval was requested for a right-of-way application submitted by Zorro Trust.

events.title: Sublease Commencement
events.description: The sublease for agricultural lease GR-2122 commenced on this date.

events.title: Sublease Expiration
events.description: The sublease for agricultural lease GR-2122 is set to expire on this date.

events.title: Field Research Completed
events.description: Field research was completed for the sublease application for Cypress, Inc.

events.title: Sublease Approval
events.description: The sublease application for Cypress, Inc. was approved by the Commissioner.

events.title: Field Visit Conducted
events.description: A field visit was conducted to evaluate the condition of the leased lands.

events.title: Partial Relinquishment Approval
events.description: The Commissioner approved a partial relinquishment of grazing lease GM-2583 in favor of Zorro Trust for 1,158.97 acres.

events.title: Rental Payment Due
events.description: The annual rental payment for the grazing lease was due, with interest accruing for late payments.

events.title: Cancellation of Grass Landing Strip Permit
events.description: Zorro Ranch informs the New Mexico State Land Office that it is no longer pursuing the permitting process for a grass landing strip.

events.title: Start of Agricultural Lease GM2791
events.description: The agricultural lease GM2791 is entered into between the New Mexico State Land Office and the Zorro Trust, with Jeffrey Epstein as the contact.

events.title: Expiration of Agricultural Lease GM2791
events.description: The agricultural lease GM2791 is set to expire, prompting communications regarding renewal.

events.title: Power of Attorney Execution
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executes a limited power of attorney appointing John J. Kelly to act on behalf of the Zorro Trust.

events.title: Power of Attorney for Lease Renewal
events.description: Epstein grants Brice Gordon a limited power of attorney to renew a state land lease for the Zorro Trust.

locations: 9100 Havensight, Port of Sale, Suite 15/16, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands 00802
310 Old Santa Fe Trail, Santa Fe, NM 87504-1148
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is the trustee of the Zorro Trust and the president of Cypress, Inc.
The right-of-way easement was granted for a term of 35 years.
The assignment of the right-of-way was executed on December 16, 2011.
The right-of-way is for a water pipeline and includes specific terms regarding maintenance and liability.
The document includes various acknowledgments and signatures from officials and notaries.
The Zorro Trust is involved in multiple applications for right-of-way easements on state land.
Brice Gordon is the manager of Zorro Ranch and is actively involved in the lease applications.
Patrick H. Lyons and Melissa Armijo are key figures in the New Mexico State Land Office overseeing these applications.
Ernest Ortiz and Steve Chavez are sublessees for agricultural lease GR-2088.
Jeffrey Epstein is the trustee of the Zorro Trust, which holds agricultural leases in New Mexico.
Cypress, Inc. is a Virgin Islands corporation involved in the management of the Zorro Ranch.
Leroy A. Ulibarri is the manager of the Surface Resources Division overseeing lease applications.
Ray Powell is the Commissioner of Public Lands responsible for agricultural leases.
The sublease for agricultural lease GR-2122 commenced on October 1, 2011, and will expire on September 30, 2016.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is the trustee for the Zorro Trust and is involved in a grazing lease agreement.
John J. Kelly is the Attorney-in-Fact for Epstein, signing documents on his behalf.
The lease agreement involves a total of 1,158.97 acres of land.
The Commissioner of Public Lands, Jim Baca, oversees the lease agreement.
There are specific compliance requirements for the lessee regarding laws and regulations.
Jeffrey Epstein is the lessee of the Zorro Trust, which holds an agricultural lease in New Mexico.
The Zorro Ranch is no longer pursuing a permit for a grass landing strip on state land as of May 12, 1994.
The agricultural lease GM2791 is set to expire on September 30, 1999, and renewal contracts will be sent out in July 1999.
Darlene Maestes is the contact for compliance regarding the agricultural lease.
Ray Powell is the Commissioner of Public Lands overseeing the lease agreements.
Jeffrey E. Epstein is the trustee of the Zorro Trust.
John J. Kelly is appointed as attorney-in-fact for the Zorro Trust.
Brice Gordon is granted a limited power of attorney for lease renewals.
The document includes multiple affidavits acknowledging the powers of attorney.
The powers of attorney are related to real property transactions in New Mexico.
